translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: سوگند به شب هنگامی که فرو پوشد

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: سوگند به شب آنگاه كه جهان را در خود فرو پوشد،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: قسم به شب وقتى كه فراپوشد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: سوگند به شب چون پرده افكند،

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: قسم به شب تار هنگامی که (جهان را در پرده سیاه) بپوشاند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: سوگند به شب در آن هنگام که (روی زمین را فرا می‌گیرد، و همه‌ی اشیاء را با تاریکی خود) می‌پوشاند (و مردمان و جانداران را به استراحت و سکون می‌کشاند)! [[«یَغْشَی»: فرا می‌گیرد و می‌پوشاند.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: سوگند به شب چون فرو پوشاند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: قسم به شب در آن هنگام که (جهان را) بپوشاند،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: سوگند به شب گاهی که فراگیرد

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: سوگند به شب آنگاه كه فرو پوشد- روز يا زمين يا خورشيد را-.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: سوگند به شب هنگامی که پرده افکند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: I CALL THE night to witness when it covers over,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: By oath of the night when it covers

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: By the night enshrouding

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: By the night when it envelopeth,

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: By the night as it envelops;

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: By the night as it covers.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: By the night when it enshrouds,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: By the night as it envelops.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: By the night enshrouding

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: By the night when it envelops,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: By the night, when it envelops,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: By the night when it covers

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: By the night when it covers the day,

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: I swear by the night when it draws a veil,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Waallayli itha yaghsha

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: By the night as it veils [the earth] in darkness,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: By the Night as it conceals (the light);

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و به روز هنگامی که آشکار شود

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و سوگند به روز آنگاه كه آشكار شود،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و به روز آنگاه كه تجلى كند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: سوگند به روز چون جلوه‌گرى آغازد،

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و قسم به روز هنگامی که روشن و فروزان گردد.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: و به روز سوگند در آن هنگام که جلوه‌گر و روشن می‌گردد (و ظلمت شب را می‌راند و مردمان و جانداران را دیگر باره به جنبش و تلاش می‌اندازد)! [[«تَجَلَّی»: روشن و آشکار گردید. جلوه‌گر آمد.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و سوگند به روز چون روشن شود

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و قسم به روز هنگامی که تجلّی کند،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و روز گاهی که برتابد

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و به روز آنگاه كه روشن و پديدار شود.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و سوگند به روز هنگامی که جلوه‌گری کند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: And the day when it shines in all its glory,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And by oath of the day when it shines

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: and the day in splendour

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: By the day when it appeareth in glory,

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And by the day as it appears in brightness;

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And the day as it reveals.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: and by the day when it breaks in its glory,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: By the day as it appears.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And the day resplendent

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: by the day when it brightens,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: and by the day when it unveils.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And [by] the day when it appears

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: by the day when it appears radiant,

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And the day when it shines in brightness,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Waalnnahari itha tajalla

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: and by the day as it appears radiantly,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: By the Day as it appears in glory;

verses.text: وَ مَا خَلَقَ‌ الذَّکَرَ وَ الْأُنْثَى‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و به آنکه نر و ماده آفرید؛

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و سوگند به آن كه نر و ماده را بيافريد،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و به آنكه نر و ماده را آفريد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و [سوگند به‌] آنكه نر و ماده را آفريد،

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و قسم به مخلوقات عالم که خدا همه را جفت نر و ماده بیافرید.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: و به آن که نر و ماده را می‌آفریند. [[«الذَّکَرَ وَ الأُنثَی»: نر و ماده انسانها و حیوانها و گیاهها و همه اشیاء مراد است (نگا: رعد / 3، ذاریات / 49، یس / 36).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و سوگند به آنکه نرینه و مادینه آفرید

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و قسم به آن کس که جنس مذکّر و مؤنّث را آفرید،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و آنچه (یا آنکه) آفرید نر و ماده را

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و به آن كه نر و ماده را آفريد.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و سوگند به آن چه نر و ماده را آفرید.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: And Him who created the male and female,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And by oath of the One Who created the male and the female.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: and That which created the male and the female,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: By Him Who hath created the male and the female,

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And by Him Who created male and female;

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And He who created the male and the female.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: and by Him Who created the male and the female:

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: By Him Who created male and female.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And Him Who hath created male and female,

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: by Him who created the male and the female:

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: And by Who created the male and female,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And [by] He who created the male and female,

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: and by that (Power) which created the male and female,

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And the creating of the male and the female,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wama khalaqa alththakara waalontha

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: and by the creation of the male and the female.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: By (the mystery of) the creation of male and female;-

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: همانا تلاشتان گوناگون و پراکنده است؛

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: كه: حاصل كوششهاى شما متفاوت است.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: كه سعى و تلاش شما بسى پراكنده است [و هر كس به راهى مى‌رود]

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: كه همانا تلاش شما پراكنده است.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: (قسم به این آیات الهی) که سعی و کوشش شما مردم بسیار مختلف است (برخی بر صلاح و برخی بر فساد می‌کوشید).

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: سعی و تلاش شما جوراجور و گوناگون است (و لذا جزا و سزای شما هم متفاوت و مختلف خواهد بود). [[«شَتَّی»: جمع شَتِیت، پراکنده. مراد مختلف و متفاوت و از هم جدا است. دسته‌ای نیکوکار و پرهیزگار، و گروهی بدکردار و ناپرهیزگار، بعضی مؤمن و صادق، و برخی کافر و فاسق، و ... تلاشهائی برای درم و شکم و لذائذ نفسانی، و تلاشهائی در راه خدمت به مردمان و رضای یزدان و اجرای اوامر ربّانی.و ... این آیه بیانگر دو خطّ سیر متمایز و جهت‌گیری متفاوت است و جواب قسم است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: که کوشش شما پراکنده [و گونه‌گون‌] است‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: که سعی و تلاش شما مختلف است:

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: که کوشش شما است همانا گوناگون‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: كه هر آينه كوشش شما بسى پراكنده است- مختلف است نه يكسان-.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: (که) همانا کوشش‌تان پراکنده است.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: That your endeavour is for different ends.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Indeed your efforts differ.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: surely your striving is to diverse ends.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Verily your endeavour is diverse.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Certainly, your efforts and deeds are diverse (different in aims and purposes);

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Your endeavors are indeed diverse.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: surely your strivings are divergent.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Certainly, your efforts and deeds are diverse.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Lo! your effort is dispersed (toward divers ends).

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: your endeavours are indeed diverse.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: your striving is indeed to different ends!

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Indeed, your efforts are diverse.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: you strive in various ways.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Your striving is most surely (directed to) various (ends).

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Inna saAAyakum lashatt<u>a</u>

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: O men, you truly strive towards the most diverse ends!

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Verily, (the ends) ye strive for are diverse.

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: اما کسی که [ثروتش را در راه خدا] انفاق کرد و پرهیزکاری پیشه ساخت

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: اما كسى كه بخشايش و پرهيزگارى كرد،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: اما آنكه انفاق كرد و پارسائى نمود

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: اما آنكه [حق خدا را] داد و پروا داشت،

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: اما هر کس عطا و احسان کرد و خدا ترس و پرهیزکار شد.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: کسی که (در راه خدا دارائی خود را) بذل و بخشش کند، و پرهیزگاری پیشه سازد (و از آفریدگار خویش بهراسد). [[«أَعْطَی»: صرف کرد و داد. خرج و پخش کرد. «إتَّقَی»: از خدا ترسید. تقوا و پرهیزگاری پیشه کرد.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: حال اگر کسی [مالی‌] بخشید و پروا و پرهیز ورزید

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: امّا آن کس که (در راه خدا) انفاق کند و پرهیزگاری پیش گیرد،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس اما آنکه بخشید و پرهیزکاری کرد

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پس هر كه بخشيد- مال خود را- و پرهيزگارى كرد

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس اما آن کس که (حق را) داد و (از ناحق) پروا داشت،

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Yet he who gives to others and has fear,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: So for one who gave and practised piety

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: As for him who gives and is godfearing

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Then as for him who giveths and feareth Him.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: As for him who gives (in charity) and keeps his duty to Allah and fears Him,

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: As for him who gives and is righteous.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: As for him who gave out his wealth (for Allah's sake) and abstained (from disobeying Him),

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: As for him who gives and has Taqwa,

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: As for him who giveth and is dutiful (toward Allah)

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: As for him who gives and is Godwary

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: For him that gives and fears (Allah)

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: As for he who gives and fears Allah

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: We shall facilitate the path to bliss

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Then as for him who gives away and guards (against evil),

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Faamma man aAAta waittaqa

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: As for one who gives [to others] and fears [God],

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: So he who gives (in charity) and fears (Allah),

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و وعده نیکوتر را [که وعده خدا نسبت به پاداش انفاق و پرهیزکاری است] باور کرد؛

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و آن بهترين را تصديق كرد،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و [وعده‌ى‌] نيكو را باور داشت

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و [پاداش‌] نيكوتر را تصديق كرد،

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و به نیکویی (یعنی به نعیم آخرت با هر خیر و سعادت که در قرآن بیان شده) تصدیق کرد.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: و به پاداش خوب (خدا در این سرا، و خوبتر خدا در آن سرا) ایمان و باور داشته باشد. [[«الْحُسْنَی»: پاداش خوب خدا که در این جهان بهره مؤمنان می‌گردد (نگا: زمر / 10، نحل / 30) و پاداش بهتر خدا که در آن جهان نصیب مسلمانان می‌شود (نگا: آل‌عمران / 148، یونس / 26). خیر مطلقی که خدا آن را خیر می‌داند. یعنی آن کسی که بذل و بخشش می‌کند و پرهیزگاری پیشه می‌سازد و به خوب و خوبی ایمان دارد، و در یک کلام، حسنات و سیّئات و فضیلت و رذیلت را همسان نمی‌شمارد، و بالطبع به پاداش نیکیها و پادافره بدیها معتقد است. (الْحُسْنَی) می‌تواند صفت مشبّهه، یا صفت تفضیلی باشد.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و [وعده‌] بهشت را استوار داشت‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و جزای نیک (الهی) را تصدیق کند،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: تصدیق به نکوکاری کرد

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و آن [وعده‌] نيكو- پاداش اخروى- را باور داشت و راست انگاشت

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و به نیکوترین زندگی تصدیق کرد،

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: And affirms goodness,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And believed the best matter to be true

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: and confirms the reward most fair,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And testifieth to the Good,

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And believes in Al-Husna.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And confirms goodness.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: and affirmed the Truth of goodness:

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And believes in Al-Husna.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And believeth in goodness;

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: and confirms the best promise,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: and believes in the finest,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And believes in the best [reward],

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: for those who spend for the cause of God,

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And accepts the best,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wasaddaqa bialhusna

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: and believes in the truth of what is right,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And (in all sincerity) testifies to the best,-

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: پس به زودی او را برای راه آسانی [که انجام همه اعمال نیک به توفیق خداست] آماده می کنیم

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: پس براى بهشت آماده‌اش مى‌كنيم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: پس زودا كه راه آسانى پيش پاى او گذاريم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: بزودى راه آسانى پيش پاى او خواهيم گذاشت.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: ما هم البته کار او را (در دو عالم) سهل و آسان می‌گردانیم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: (مشکلات و موانع را برای او آسان می‌سازیم و در کار خیر توفیقش می‌دهیم و) او را آماده‌ی رفاه و آسایش می‌نمائیم. [[«نُیَسِّرُهُ»: او را مهیّا و آماده می‌سازیم. «الْیُسْرَی»: رفاه و آسایش. ساده و آسان. آیه متضمّن دو معنی است: الف - او را آماده برای زندگی خوش و آسوده آخرت می‌سازیم (نگا: نحل / 97). ب - او را آماده انجام کارهای ساده و آسانی می‌سازیم که پیشتر برای او مشکل و دشوار بود. یعنی در پرتو گام نهادن به راه خدا مشکلات را برایش ساده و در انجام آنها توفیقش می‌دهیم (نگا: مائده / 16، عنکبوت / 69). اصولاً ایمان به معاد و پاداش عظیم الهی، مشکلات را در نظر انسان سهل و آسان جلوه‌گر می‌سازد و نه تنها مال، بلکه جان خود را در طبق اخلاص می‌گذارد و از این ایثارگری لذّت می‌برد.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: زودا که راهش را به سوی خیر و آسانی هموار کنیم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: ما او را در مسیر آسانی قرار می‌دهیم!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: زود است رهنمونش شویم بسوی گشایش‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پس زودا كه او را براى راه آسان- خير يا راه راست و شريعت آسان يا بهشت يا همه اينها- آماده سازيم.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: به زودی او را برای آسان‌ترین (زندگی)، راهوار و آسان کنیم.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: We shall ease the way of fortune for him.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: So We will very soon provide him ease.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: We shall surely ease him to the Easing.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Unto him therefore We shall indeed make easy the path to ease.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: We will make smooth for him the path of ease (goodness).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: We will ease his way towards ease.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: We shall facilitate for him the Way to Bliss.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: We will make smooth for him the path of ease.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Surely We will ease his way unto the state of ease.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: We will surely ease him toward facility.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: We shall surely ease him to the Path of Easing;

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: We will ease him toward ease.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: observe piety, and believe in receiving rewards from God.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: We will facilitate for him the easy end.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Fasanuyassiruhu lilyusr<u>a</u>

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: We will pave his way to ease.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: We will indeed make smooth for him the path to Bliss.

verses.text: وَ أَمَّا مَنْ‌ بَخِلَ‌ وَ اسْتَغْنَى‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و اما کسی که [از انفاق ثروت] بخل ورزید و خود را بی نیاز نشان داد

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: اما آن كس كه بخل و بى نيازى ورزيد،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و اما آن كه بخل ورزيد و [از دين‌] بى‌نيازى نمود

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و اما آنكه بخل ورزيد و خود را بى‌نياز ديد،

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: اما هر کس بخل ورزید و خود را (از لطف خدا) بی نیاز دانست.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: و امّا کسی که تنگ‌چشمی بکند (و به بذل و بخشش دارائی در راه خدا دست نیازد) و خود را بی‌نیاز (از خدا و توفیق و پاداش دنیوی و اخروی الهی) بداند. [[«إسْتَغْنَی»: خود را بی‌نیاز دانست. مراد بی‌نیاز از خدا، و مدد و یاری دنیوی، و اجر و پاداش اخروی یزدان جهان است (نگا: عبس / 5).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و اما کسی که دریغ‌ورزید و بی‌نیازی نمود

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: امّا کسی که بخل ورزد و (از این راه) بی‌نیازی طلبد،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و اما آنکه بخل ورزید و بی‌نیازی گرفت‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و اما هر كه بخل ورزيد- حق خدا را در مال ادا نكرد- و بى‌نيازى نمود- از دين حق و ثواب الهى-

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و اما آن کس که بخل ورزید و خود را بی‌نیاز دید،

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: But he who does not give and is unconcerned,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And for him who hoarded wealth and remained carefree,

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: But as for him who is a miser, and self-sufficient,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And as for him who stinteth and is heedless,

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: But he who is greedy miser and thinks himself self-sufficient.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: But as for him who is stingy and complacent.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: As for him who was a miser and behaved with aversion (to Allah),

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: But he who is greedy and thinks himself self-sufficient,

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: But as for him who hoardeth and deemeth himself independent,

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: But as for him, who is stingy and self-complacent,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: but for him that is a miser, and sufficed,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: But as for he who withholds and considers himself free of need

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: But for those who are niggardly, horde their wealth,

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And as for him who is niggardly and considers himself free from need (of Allah),

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Waamma man bakhila waistaghna

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: But as for one who is miserly and unheeding,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: But he who is a greedy miser and thinks himself self-sufficient,

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و وعده نیکوتر را تکذیب کرد،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و آن بهترين را تكذيب كرد،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و آن [وعده‌ى‌] نيكو را انكار كرد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و [پاداش‌] نيكوتر را به دروغ گرفت،

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و نیکویی را تکذیب کرد.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: و به پاداش خوب (خدا در این سرا، و خوبتر خدا در آن سرا) ایمان و باور نداشته باشد. [[«الْحُسْنَی»: (نگا: آیه ششم).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و وعده بهشت را دروغ انگاشت‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و پاداش نیک (الهی) را انکار کند،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و تکذیب به نیکوکاری کرد

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و آن [وعده‌] نيكو را انكار كرد و دروغ انگاشت

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و نیکوترین (زندگی) را تکذیب کرد،

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: And rejects goodness,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And denied the best matter,

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: and cries lies to the reward most fair,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And who belieth the Good,

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And gives the lie to Al-Husna (see Verse No: 6 footnote);

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And denies goodness.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: and denied the Truth of goodness:

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And denies Al-Husna.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And disbelieveth in goodness;

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: and denies the best promise,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: and he belied the finest

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And denies the best [reward],

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: and have no faith in receiving any reward (from God).

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And rejects the best,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wakaththaba bialhusna

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: and rejects what is right,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And gives the lie to the best,-

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: پس او را برای راه سخت و دشواری [که سلب هرگونه توفیق از اوست] آماده می کنیم،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: او را براى دوزخ آماده مى‌سازيم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: پس زودا كه طريقه سختى پيش وى آريم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: بزودى راه دشوارى به او خواهيم نمود.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: پس به زودی کار او را (در دو عالم) دشوار می‌کنیم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: او را آماده برای سختی و مشقّت (و زندگی بس مشکل و ناگوار دوزخ) می‌سازیم. [[«الْعُسْرَی»: سختی و مشقّت. شدّت و محنت. خواری ناشی از عدم توفیق در اعمال صالحه (نگا: المیزان). عذاب دوزخ.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: زودا که راهش را به سوی شر و دشواری هموار کنیم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: بزودی او را در مسیر دشواری قرار می‌دهیم؛

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس زود است برانیمش بسوی دشواری‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پس زودا كه او را براى راه دشوار- شرّ كه گمراهى و كفر و آتش دوزخ است- آماده سازيم.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: به زودی او را برای سخت‌ترین (زندگی‌)، راهوار و آسان کنیم.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: For him We shall ease the way of adversity,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: So We will very soon provide him hardship.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: We shall surely ease him to the Hardship;

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Unto him therefore We shall Indeed make easy the path to hardship.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: We will make smooth for him the path for evil;

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: We will ease his way towards difficulty.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: We shall facilitate for him the way to Hardship,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: We will make smooth for him the path to evil.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Surely We will ease his way unto adversity.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: We will surely ease him toward hardship.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: We shall surely ease for him the Path of Hardship (the Fire).

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: We will ease him toward difficulty.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: We shall facilitate the path to affliction

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: We will facilitate for him the difficult end.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Fasanuyassiruhu lilAAusr<u>a</u>

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: We shall pave his way to hardship,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: We will indeed make smooth for him the path to Misery;

verses.text: وَ مَا يُغْنِي‌ عَنْهُ‌ مَالُهُ‌ إِذَا تَرَدَّى‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و هنگامی که [به چاه هلاکت و گودال گور] سقوط کند ثروتش [چیزی از عذاب خدا] را از او دفع نمی کند.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و چون هلاكش دررسد، دارايى‌اش به حالش سود نبخشد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و آن‌گاه كه به هلاكت افتد، مالش به حال او سودى ندهد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و چون هلاك شد، [ديگر] مال او به كارش نمى‌آيد.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و گاه عذاب و هلاکت داراییش وی را هیچ نجات نتواند داد.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: در آن هنگام که (به گور) پرت می‌گردد، دارائیش چه سودی به حال او دارد؟ [[«مَا یُغْنِی عَنْهُ»: چه سودی به حال او دارد؟ سودی به حال او ندارد. واژه (مَا) استفهامیّه و برای انکار، یا حرف نفی است. «تَردَّی»: پرت گردید. سقوط کرد. مراد سقوط در قبر یا سرنگون شدن به دوزخ است. هلاک شد و مرد.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و چون به هلاکت افتد مالش به کار او نیاید

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و در آن هنگام که (در جهنّم) سقوط می‌کند، اموالش به حال او سودی نخواهد داشت!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و بی‌نیاز نکند از او مالش گاهی که تباه شود

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و چه سود دارد او را مالش آنگاه كه به هلاكت درافتد.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و هنگامی که سقوط کرد، (دیگر) مالش به کارش نیاید.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: And his riches will not avail him when he falls headlong (into the Abyss).

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: His wealth will not avail him when he falls into ruin.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: his wealth shall not avail him when he perishes.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And his substance will avail him not when he perisheth.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And what will his wealth benefit him when he goes down (in destruction).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And his money will not avail him when he plummets.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: and his wealth shall be of no avail to him when he perishes.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And what will his wealth avail him when he goes down (in destruction)

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: His riches will not save him when he perisheth.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: His wealth will not avail him when he perishes.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: When he falls (into Hell), his wealth will not help him.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And what will his wealth avail him when he falls?

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: and their wealth will be of no benefit to them when they face destruction.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And his wealth will not avail him when he perishes.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wam<u>a</u> yughnee AAanhu m<u>a</u>luhu i<u>tha</u> taradd<u>a</u>

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: nor will his wealth profit him when he falls [into the pit].

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Nor will his wealth profit him when he falls headlong (into the Pit).

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: بی تردید هدایت کردن بر عهده ماست.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و آنچه بر ماست راهنمايى است.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: همانا هدايت بر عهده‌ى ماست

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: همانا هدايت بر ماست.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و البته بر ماست که (خلق را) هدایت کنیم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: مسلّماً نشان دادن (راه هدایت و ضلالت به مردم) بر عهده‌ی ما است. [[«عَلَیْنَا»: بر ما است. «الْهُدَی»: رهنمود. راهنمائی. ارائه طریق.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: بی‌گمان راهنمایی [بندگان‌] بر ماست‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: به یقین هدایت کردن بر ماست،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: همانا بر ما است هدایت‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: هر آينه رهنمونى بر ماست.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: همواره تنها بر (عهده‌ی) ما بی‌شک هدایت‌گری است.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: It is indeed for Us to show the way,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Indeed guiding is upon Us.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Surely upon Us rests the guidance,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Verify on us is the guidance

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Truly! Ours it is (to give) guidance,

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: It is upon Us to guide.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Surely it is for Us to show the Right Way,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Truly, on Us is (to give) guidance.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Lo! Ours it is (to give) the guidance

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Indeed guidance rests with Us,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Indeed, Guidance is Ours,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Indeed, [incumbent] upon Us is guidance.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Surely, in Our hands is guidance,

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Surely Ours is it to show the way,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Inna AAalayn<u>a</u> lalhud<u>a</u>

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Surely, it is for Us to provide guidance --

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Verily We take upon Ourselves to guide,

verses.text: وَ إِنَ‌ لَنَا لَلْآخِرَةَ وَ الْأُولَى‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و به یقین دنیا و آخرت در سیطره مالکیّت ماست.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و از آنِ ماست آن جهان و اين جهان.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و آخرت و دنيا هم متعلق به ماست

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و در حقيقت، دنيا و آخرت از آن ماست.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و ملک دنیا و آخرت از ماست (به هر که بخواهیم و صلاح دانیم می‌بخشیم).

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: و قطعاً آخرت و دنیا همه از آن ما است. [[«لَلآخِرَةَ وَ الأُولَی»: آن جهان و این جهان. مقدّم شدن آخرت بر دنیا، به خاطر اهمّیّت فراوان و مقصود اصلی بودنِ آن است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و بی‌گمان [جهان‌] واپسین و نخستین ما راست‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و آخرت و دنیا از آن ماست،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و همانا برای ما است بازپسین و نخستین‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و هر آينه ما راست آن جهان و اين جهان.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و به‌راستی دنیا و آخرت به‌درستی از ماست.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: And to Us belong the End and the Beginning.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And indeed the Hereafter and this world both belong to Us.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: and to Us belong the Last and the First.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And verify Ours is both the Hereafter and the life present.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And truly, unto Us (belong) the last (Hereafter) and the first (this world).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And to Us belong the Last and the First.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: and to Us belong the Next Life and the present.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And truly, unto Us (belong) the last (Hereafter) and the first (this world).

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And lo! unto Us belong the latter portion and the former.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: and to Us belong the world and the Hereafter.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: and to Us belong the Last and the First.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And indeed, to Us belongs the Hereafter and the first [life].

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: and to Us belong the hereafter and the worldly life.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And most surely Ours is the hereafter and the former.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wainna lana lalakhirata waaloola

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: and to Us belongs the Hereafter as well as the present world --

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And verily unto Us (belong) the End and the Beginning.

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: پس شما را از آتشی که زبانه می کشد بیم می دهم.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: پس شما را از آتشى كه زبانه مى‌كشد مى‌ترسانم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: پس شما را به آتشى كه زبانه كشد بيم دادم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: پس شما را به آتشى كه زبانه مى‌كشد هشدار دادم.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: من شما را از آتش شعله‌ور دوزخ ترسانیدم و آگاه ساختم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: من شما را از آتش هولناکی بیم می‌دهم که شعله‌ور می‌شود و زبانه می‌کشد. [[«فَأَنذَرْتُکُمْ»: فاعل پیغمبر اسلام است که خطاب به کفّار مکّه صحبت می‌فرماید. «تَلَظَّی»: شعله‌ور می‌شود. زبانه می‌کشد. فعل مضارع است و در اصل (تَتَلَظَّی) است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: پس شما را از آتشی که زبانه زند هشدار دهم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و من شما را از آتشی که زبانه می‌کشد بیم می‌دهم،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس ترسانیدم شما را از آتش که زبانه کشد

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پس شما را از آتشى كه زبانه مى‌كشد بيم مى‌دهم.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس شما را به آتشی زبانه‌دار هشدار دادم.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: So, I warn you of the blazing Fire.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: I therefore warn you of the fire that is ablaze.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Now I have warned you of a Fire that flames,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Wherefore have warned you of Fire flaming,

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Therefore I have warned you of a Fire blazing fiercely (Hell);

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: I have warned you of a Fierce Blaze.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: I have now warned you of a Blazing Fire,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Therefore I have warned you of a Fire Talazza.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Therefor have I warned you of the flaming Fire

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: So I warn you of a blazing fire,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: I have now warned you of the Blazing Fire,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: So I have warned you of a Fire which is blazing.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: I have warned you about the fierce blazing fire

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Therefore I warn you of the fire that flames:

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Faanthartukum naran talaththa

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: I have warned you then about a raging Fire:

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Therefore do I warn you of a Fire blazing fiercely;

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: [که] جز بدبخت ترین مردم در آن در نیایند.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: جز اهل شقاوت بدان درنيفتد:

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: كه جز تيره بخت‌ترين مردم، بدان نسوزد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: جز نگون‌بخت‌تر[ين مردم‌] در آن درنيايد:

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: که هیچ کس در آن آتش در نیفتد مگر شقی‌ترین خلق.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: بدان داخل نمی‌شود و نمی‌سوزد مگر بدبخت‌ترین (انسانها). [[«الأَشْقَی»: بدبخت‌ترین.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: که جز شقاوت پیشه وارد آن نشود

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: کسی جز بدبخت‌ترین مردم وارد آن نمی‌شود؛

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: نچشدش جز بدبخت تری‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: در آن درنيايد و بدان نسوزد مگر آن بدبخت‌تر

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: جز شقی‌ترین (مکلفان) آن را نیفروزد.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: No one will burn in it but the most wretched,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: None except the most wicked will enter it.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: whereat none but the most wretched shall be roasted,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: None shall roast therein but the most wretched,

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: None shall enter it save the most wretched,

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: None will burn in it except the very wicked.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: where none shall burn except the most wicked,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: None shall enter it save the most wretched.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Which only the most wretched must endure,

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: which none shall enter except the most wretched [of persons]

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: in which none shall be roasted except the most wretched sinner,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: None will [enter to] burn therein except the most wretched one.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: in which no one will suffer forever

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: None shall enter it but the most unhappy,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: L<u>a</u> ya<u>s</u>l<u>a</u>h<u>a</u> ill<u>a</u> alashq<u>a</u>

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: none shall enter it but the most wicked,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: None shall reach it but those most unfortunate ones

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: همان که [دین را] تکذیب کرد و از آن روی گردانید.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: آن كه تكذيب كرد و رويگردان شد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: همان كه تكذيب كرد و رخ برتافت

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: همان كه تكذيب كرد و رخ برتافت.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: همان کس که (آیات و رسل حق را) تکذیب کرد و روی از آن بگردانید.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: همان کسی که (حق و حقیقت را دروغ می‌داند و آن را) تکذیب می‌نماید و (به آیات آسمانی) پشت می‌کند. [[«تَوَلَّی»: پشت کرد. رویگردان شد (نگا: بقره / 205، آل‌عمران / 82، نجم / 29).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: همان کسی که [حق را] انکار کرد و روی بر تافت‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: همان کس که (آیات خدا را) تکذیب کرد و به آن پشت نمود!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: که تکذیب کند و پشت کند

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: آن كه تكذيب كرد و [از حق‌] برگشت.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: کسی که تکذیب کرد و رخ برتافت.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Who denied (the truth) and turned away.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: The one who denied and turned away.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: even he who cried lies, and turned away;

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Who belieth and turneth away.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Who denies and turns away.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: He who denies and turns away.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: who rejected the Truth, calling it falsehood and turned his back on it.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Who denies and turns away.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: He who denieth and turneth away.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: —he who impugns [God’s prophets] and turns his back.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: who belied and turned away,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Who had denied and turned away.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: except the wicked ones who have rejected the (Truth) and have turned away from it.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Who gives the lie (to the truth) and turns (his) back.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Alla<u>th</u>ee ka<u>thth</u>aba watawall<u>a</u>

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: who denied [the truth], and turned away.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Who give the lie to Truth and turn their backs.

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و به زودی پرهیزکارترین [مردم] را از آن دور می دارند.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و پرهيزگارترين مردم را از آن دور دارند:

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: زودا كه پرهيزكارترين مردم، از آن دور داشته شود

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و پاك‌رفتارتر[ين مردم‌] از آن دور داشته خواهد شد:

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و اهل تقوا را از آن آتش دور سازند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: ولیکن پرهیزگارترین (انسانها) از آن (آتش هولناک) به دور داشته خواهد شد. [[«الأتْقَی»: پرهیزگارترین.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و تقواپیشه از آن دور داشته خواهد شد

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و بزودی با تقواترین مردم از آن دور داشته می‌شود،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و زود است دور شودش پرهیزکارتری‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و زودا كه آن پرهيزگارتر، از آن

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و زودا (که) پرهیزگارترین (مکلفان) از آن به شایستگی دور داشته خواهد شد.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: But save him who fears

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: He will be far away from the most pious. (The first Caliph S. Abu Bakr Siddiq)

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: and from which the most godfearing shall be removed,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And avoid it shall the most pious,

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And Al-Muttaqun (the pious and righteous - see V. 2:2) will be far removed from it (Hell).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: But the devout will avoid it.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: But the God-fearing shall be kept away from it,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And those with Taqwa will be far removed from it.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Far removed from it will be the righteous

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: The Godwary [person] will be spared of that

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: and from which the cautious shall be distanced.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: But the righteous one will avoid it -

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: The pious ones who spend for the cause of God

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And away from it shall be kept the one who guards most (against evil),

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wasayujannabuh<u>a</u> alatq<u>a</u>

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: One who fears God shall be kept away from it --

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: But those most devoted to Allah shall be removed far from it,-

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: همان که مال خود را انفاق می کند تا [مال] رشد و نمو کند.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: آن كه مال خويش مى‌بخشايد و پاكى مى‌جويد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: همان كه مال خود را مى‌دهد تا پاك شود

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: همان كه مال خود را مى‌دهد [براى آنكه‌] پاك شود،

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: آن کس که مال خود را (به فقیران اسلام) به وجه زکات بدهد.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: آن کسی که دارائی خود را (در راه خدا خرج می‌کند و) می‌دهد تا خویشتن را (به وسیله‌ی این کار، از کثافت بخل) پاکیزه بدارد. [[«یَتَزَکَّی»: خود را پاک می‌دارد و پاکیزه می‌کند. حال یا بدل از فاعل است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: همان کسی که مالش را می‌بخشد که پاکدلی یابد

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: همان کس که مال خود را (در راه خدا) می‌بخشد تا پاک شود.

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: که دهد مالش را پاکی جوید

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: آن كه مال خود را مى‌دهد تا پاك و پيراسته شود- از پليدى بخل و امساك-.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: کسی که مال خود را می‌دهد، در حالی که خود را پاک می‌کند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: And gives of his wealth that he may grow in virtue,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Who gives his wealth in order to be pure.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: even he who gives his wealth. to purify himself

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Who giveth away his substance that he may be cleansed,

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: He who spends his wealth for increase in self-purification,

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: He who gives his money to become pure.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: the Godfearing who spends his wealth to purify himself;

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: He who gives of his wealth for self-purification.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Who giveth his wealth that he may grow (in goodness).

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: —he who gives his wealth to purify himself

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: He who gives his wealth to be purified,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: [He] who gives [from] his wealth to purify himself

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: and purify themselves will be safe from this fire.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Who gives away his wealth, purifying himself

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Alla<u>th</u>ee yutee m<u>a</u>lahu yatazakk<u>a</u>

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: one who gives his wealth to become purified,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Those who spend their wealth for increase in self-purification,

verses.text: وَ مَا لِأَحَدٍ عِنْدَهُ‌ مِنْ‌ نِعْمَةٍ تُجْزَى‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و هیچ کس را نزد خدا حق نعمتی نیست تا این مالی که انفاق کرده به عنوان پاداش آن نعمت به حساب او گذارد.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و هيچ كس را بر او حقى نباشد كه اينك پاداش خواهد،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و هيچ كس را نزد او حق نعمتى نيست تا او را پاداش دهد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و هيچ كس را به قصد پاداش‌يافتن نعمت نمى‌بخشد،

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و حال آنکه هیچ کس بر وی حق نعمت ندارد تا به پاداش آن بدهد.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: هیچ کسی بر او حق نعمتی ندارد تا (بدین وسیله به نعمتش پاسخ گوید و از سوی او آن) نعمت جزا داده شود. [[«تُجْزَی»: نعمت جزا داده شود. سپاس گفته شود.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و بر او [منت از] نعمت کسی نیست که باید جزایش را بدهد

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و هیچ کس را نزد او حق نعمتی نیست تا بخواهد (به این وسیله) او را جزا دهد،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و نیست کسی را نزدش نعمتی که پاداش داده شود

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و هيچ كس را نزد او نعمتى نيست كه بايست پاداش داده شود- انفاق او به تلافى يا به پس‌دادن حقوق ديگران نيست-.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و برای احدی نزد او نعمتی دارای پاداش نیست‌.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: And is under no one's obligation to return his favour,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And no one has done a favour to him, for which he should be compensated.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: and confers no favour on any man for recompense,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And who hath no favour from anyone to recompense.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And have in his mind no favour from anyone for which a reward is expected in return,

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Seeking no favor in return.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: not as payment for any favours that he received,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And who has (in mind) no favor from anyone to be paid back.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And none hath with him any favour for reward,

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: and does not expect any reward from anyone,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: and confers no favor upon anyone for recompense

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And not [giving] for anyone who has [done him] a favor to be rewarded

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: They do not expect any reward

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And no one has with him any boon for which he should be rewarded,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wam<u>a</u> lia<u>h</u>adin AAindahu min niAAmatin tujz<u>a</u>

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: and owes no favour to anyone, which is to be repaid,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And have in their minds no favour from anyone for which a reward is expected in return,

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: بلکه [انفاق کننده با تقوا مال خود را در راه خدا انفاق می کند] تا خشنودی پروردگار والایش را به دست آورد.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: مگر جستن خشنودى پروردگار والاى خويش.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: جز طلب رضاى پروردگار والايش

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: جز خواستن رضاى پروردگارش كه بسى برتر است [منظورى ندارد].

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: (او احسان نکند) جز در طلب رضای خدای خود که برتر و بالاترین موجودات است.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: بلکه تنها هدف او جلب رضای ذات پروردگار بزرگوارش می‌باشد. [[«إبْتِغَآءَ»: خواستار شدن. طلبیدن. «وَجْهِ»: ذات (نگا: انعام / 52، کهف / 28، قصص / 88).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: [و نمی‌کند آنچه می‌کند] مگر در طلب خشنودی پروردگار بلندمرتبه‌اش‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: بلکه تنها هدفش جلب رضای پروردگار بزرگ اوست؛

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: جز در پی روی پروردگار برترش‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: جز آنكه براى جستن خشنودى پروردگار والاى خويش [انفاق مى‌كند].

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: جز خواستن رضای پروردگارش که بسی برتر است (منظوری ندارد).

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Other than seeking the glory of his Lord, most high,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: He desires only to please his Lord, the Supreme.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: only seeking the Face of his Lord the Most High;

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: But only seeking the Countenance of his Lord the Most High.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Except only the desire to seek the Countenance of his Lord, the Most High;

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Only seeking the acceptance of his Lord, the Most High.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: but only to seek the good pleasure of his Lord Most High.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Except to seek the Face of his Lord, the Most High.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Except as seeking (to fulfil) the purpose of his Lord Most High.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: but seek only the pleasure of their Lord, the Most Exalted,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: seeking only the Face of his Lord, the Most High,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: But only seeking the countenance of his Lord, Most High.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: except the pleasure of their Lord, the Most High

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Except the seeking of the pleasure of his Lord, the Most High.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Ill<u>a</u> ibtigh<u>a</u>a wajhi rabbihi alaAAl<u>a</u>

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: acting only for the sake of his Lord the Most High --

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: But only the desire to seek for the Countenance of their Lord Most High;

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و [بی تردید] به زودی [در قیامت با دریافت لطف، رحمت حق و پاداش بی پایان او] خشنود خواهد شد.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و زودا كه خشنود شود.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و به زودى خشنود گردد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و قطعاً بزودى خشنود خواهد شد.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و البته (در بهشت آخرت به آن نعمتهای ابدی) خشنود خواهد گردید.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: قطعاً (چنین شخصی، از کارهائی که کرده است) راضی خواهد بود و (از پاداشهائی که از پروردگار خود دریافت می‌دارد) خوشنود خواهد شد. [[«لَسَوْفَ یَرْضَی»: راضی خواهد بود. راضی خواهد شد (نگا: توبه / 96، نجم / 26).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و زودا که خشنود شود

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و بزودی راضی و خشنود می‌شود!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و همانا بزودی خوشنود شود

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و هر آينه خشنود خواهد شد- آنگاه كه به ثواب و پاداش خود برسد-.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و همانا در آینده‌ای دور، خشنود خواهد شد.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Will surely be gratified.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And indeed, soon he will be very pleased.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: and he shall surely be satisfied.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And presently he shall become wellpleased.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: He surely will be pleased (when he will enter Paradise).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And he will be satisfied.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: He will surely be well-pleased (with him).

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: He, surely, will be pleased.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: He verily will be content.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: and, surely, soon they will be well-pleased.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: surely, he shall be satisfied.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And he is going to be satisfied.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: and the reward (of their Lord) will certainly make them happy.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And he shall soon be well-pleased.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Walasawfa yar<u>da</u>

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: and before long he will be well satisfied.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And soon will they attain (complete) satisfaction.
